short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Use tabsets.net to safely keep track of all your tabs and links in the Side Panel, stored locally on your browser

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
With the Tabsets Extension, you'll have a new way to organise your Links, Tabs, and Bookmarks - store and find any website quickly.

Current Release News:
 * security advisory on jsonpath-plus, updated version

Why tabsets.net instead of bookmarks?

* It runs in the Side Panel :)
* Your data is stored solely on your own computer (unless you use the upcoming sync feature)
* Share tabsets with friends and colleagues

Why tabsets.net as a tab manager?

* Integrates Bookmarks: simply use both
* Organise your tabs using: tags, domains, folders, colors etc.

The source code is open source and available at GitHub.

Do not navigate through multiple levels of folders of your browsers bookmark manager until you might find what you were looking for. 

This is what you can do instead:

  - Organise and Manage everything in your Browser's SidePanel
  - Utilise multiple windows and access them with inline window manager
  - Search for websites easily (by URL, title, or even content)
  - Quick access to your bookmarks (optional feature*)
  - Conveniently find and open an URL, or open all tabs of a set
  - Archive Tabsets (for later use) (optional feature*)
  - Quick access: newest tabs, most used tabs, tabs by domain
  
Further Features:

 - Dark Mode
 - Import and export Tabsets as JSON 
 - Use Color Markers for Organising (optional feature*)
 - Use Chrome Tab Groups (optional experimental feature*)
  
*) optional features need to be activated in the settings page
